name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Atlanta - Marietta

reviews.text: I stay here at least twice per month.. On average I stay here 40-46 days per year. This hotel is improvement. They want a premium price for a outdated room. The staff used to be great! The new staff needs training. I miss seeing familiar faces. If you stay as much as I do you except to be greeted in a friendly manner. I can not remmebr the last time I saw a friendly face. I hope this will change.
reviews.title: Needs Improvement

reviews.text: I am a hilton diamond member. The LEAST I expect is water in my room. Half the tme I do not have it.
reviews.title: Great family hotel reasonable price suite vs room

reviews.text: The restaurant is going down hill FAST. I always order the same dish. It is different each time I order it. It is the warm bread salad. Please I am so tired of the burnt bread you put in it!!! This is one of the few things that are edible on their recently new (the past year) menu. The restaurnant needs help BAD!!!!!!!!!!! I feel bad for the servers having to work here because the food is so bad and SLOW! Who would want to eat here. The wine and beer prices are also so high. This hotel is NOT in Buckhead. You can not charge these prices. The restaurant needs SO much help!!!!
reviews.title: Just Average for a Doubletree...

reviews.text: The walls are also very thin. You can hear everything that goes on in the hall and rooms next to you. The hotel needs to be updated.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel But Won't Find On GSP
Horrible customer service
reviews.text: I few months ago I rated this hotel very well.. It is goinf down hill!! I hope the mangement will react and fix the problems. The hotel needs updating and help with the noice level.

The hotel is nice overall. The room was very clean and had comfortable beds. My only complaint is the noise. My room was located across from where the ice machine is, so of course there was a lot of traffic. I could hear the machine running all night & the ice dropping. Also, I could clearly hear anyone talking in the hallway, even if they were speaking in a low voice. So, if you are a light sleeper, I wouldn't recommend this hotel. Decent place, just too noisy!
reviews.title: Great except for the noise.

reviews.text: I would consider this a "basic hotel". The location was perfect with great access to major roadways, restaurants and shopping. The property itself certainly served its purpose...nothing negative to say, yet pretty basic. The staff was friendly, room clean, albeit a bit dated. If need be and the price was right, I'd stay here again. That said, not much in the way of a "WOW" factor...but that wasn't expected.
reviews.title: Nice location...easy access.

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone, for the location and the value. The early December weekend rate was unbeatable anywhere ($52 a night plus tax, AAA), easy access to I-75 and I-285, and close to the Cumberland Mall. Plenty of options for dining, shopping and activity nearby. There are a multitude of hotels in this vicinity, owing to this Doubletree's competitive rate.
reviews.title: Great value and accessibility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff are friendly and helpful, and as I've encountered almost everywhere else in the Atlanta area, easy-going. The lobby area is inviting and comfortable, with a business centre, coffee outlet and restaurant right there. As I encountered during my stay, this property and its amazing rates will tend to attract large groups and functions, so prepare for that kind of traffic. There was obviously a teenage girls soccer competition going on nearby, as they were coming and going from the hotel by the vanload all weekend, but they were not disruptive during the overnight hours.
reviews.title: Great half way point between Ohio and Florida with LOW AAA rates.

reviews.text: The rooms appear a bit tired, and the amenities are predictable for Doubletree - warm cookie, comfortable bed and pillows, nice soap and shampoo, fluffy towels, in-room coffee, and a complimentary coffee at the coffee bar. There is free wifi in the lobby only (pay extra for in-room). There's not a lot of channels on TV, which is an older tube-style, but for all that, consider the rates.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for business. The location was good for where I needed to be and is not far from Atlanta. The parking lot gets really packed as others have mentioned. As in most Doubletree Hotels, the bed was one of the most positive features of the room, excellent. The room was very spacious but lacked a fridge. There was an ice and soda machine close by but I would still prefer the convenience of a fridge in the room. Service was pretty good, I needed to print some paperwork at the hotel and I was able to use their computer and printer free of charge. The breakfast was pretty good and the cookies excellent.
reviews.title: Decent hotel in Marietta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, this is a good hotel for business, not luxurious but very decent.
reviews.title: Comfortable

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Doubletree at South Park near Windy Hill Atlanta. Great staff, and clean, comfortable room. I did notice that the carpet had not been cleaned in a while and the chair had some stains on it. I eat breatfast in the cafe and found that they had a wide range of breakfast foods, plus the buffet. I got there late and the buffet wasn't very good, especially the powered eggs.
reviews.title: Business Travel

reviews.text: I would however recommend this hotel for its location, overall cleaniness and great service.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: I recently stayed here four nights alone on business. The location is ideal for those that need easy access to the major expressways. There are a plethora of restaurant chains in close proximity as well as a mall, Target, and Starbucks. As a woman traveling alone I never felt uncomfortable. The Mondo Cafe serves a breakfast buffet. The food and selection was just okay. However, the attending staff were very welcoming. My room had a king sized bed which was quite comfy. However, I was on the second floor so had little view or natural light to enjoy. I did take time out to visit the hot tub spa which was the highlight of my trip by far. The indoor and outdoor pools are aligned near each which makes them appear connected. The spa looks beautiful at night and I recommend everyone enjoy the hot tub or pool before they check out.
reviews.title: Very Decent Doubletree

reviews.text: I stayed the night for our 25th class reunion that was held there with no complaints except for the temperature of the room I stayed in. The room the reunion was held in was a nice size, comfortable and the food was FANTASTIC! I was already prepared for no fridge or microwave, which I ended up with neither in the room. No worries though. Cooler was filled to the rim with ice from their ice machine. However, the room temperature took quite a while to cool down. Thank goodness for the big sliding glass door that I could open with a very small balcony and the fan I brought along. The room temp really didn't impact my stay since I would stay there again. Based off of the room and size of it, Doubletree could put a cabinet type piece of furniture in that room that holds a small fridge and microwave with the neat little coffee maker on top. My room was on the interstate side. The noise wasn't bad; the car wash that ran all day made more noise than the interstate. But still, it quit and then it was just "city" noise you would hear anywhere else. All in all, the staff/employees were very friendly and helpful and I would stay there again.
reviews.title: 11/5/11 stay

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for a second time recently and when I got checked in it was rather late in the evening. I arrived at my room (201) and it was right next to the elevator and just above the lobby entrance. I should have gone back down and asked to switch rooms, but I didn't. Big mistake. There was plenty of elevator noise and about 6 a.m. people were standing outside smoking and talking and I heard every word they said. So definitely avoid rooms with lower last numbers like 01, 03 and 05. Once I switched to room 140 I had no problems at all. It was at the end of the hall and very quiet.
reviews.title: Comfortable and clean, but had noise issues

reviews.text: Stayed there for a course that was offered just across the street. Good location due to that, but overall, not very impressed. Beds were not very comfortable. Very noisy. Walls were very thin and there were many noises all night in the halls. There was no complimentary anything. There is a restaurant on property but I paid 3.95 for a cup of coffee. Good location for my purpose but would not stay there again.
reviews.title: Okay for a business stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for a friend's wedding. The hotel was very nice but the walls could have been much more sound proof. We could hear people opening and closing their doors and conversations in the hallway. The price was awesome or so we thought…it was $74.00 per night but included NOTHING…that is where they get you…most hotels offer free wireless now…NOPE it was $9.95 per day. No fridge or microwave in rooms...but you could rent them...REALLY! The breakfast buffet was so costly we would have done better ordering room service or just going out to eat. The room itself was nicely decorated and I love the bathroom amenities (you can never go wrong with Crabtree and Evelyn) the shower was AWESOME...I love a strong shower. If you decide to enjoy the breakfast buffet purchase it in advance. I was not aware that you could purchase advance tickets for only $8.00! Without it a breakfast for two was $27.90!!!!!! My mouth hit the floor and this buffet was NO where near worth the money. All and all I may stay here again....it was CLEAN which is always number one on my list.
reviews.title: Nice stay...but could be better!

reviews.text: We stayed here using American Advantage miles. The front desk staff were very nice. There wasn't a refrigerator, but we were able to rent one for $10/night. Since we had a young child who needed her milk, it was worth it to us. The room itself was nice; it was non smoking, but the hallway reeked of cigarettes. Our neighbors woke us up at 1:30 shaking the bed so hard, their iron headboard was banging against the wall (use your imagination). The breakfast the next morning was typical - eggs, bacon/sausage, potatoes. If you're looking for reasonably prices, this is it. Overall, a good trip.
reviews.title: Very Nice

description: Explore Atlanta attractions while visiting the DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Atlanta – Marietta, located just off I-75 and I-285. Our hotel near Marietta provides quick access to Dobbins Air Reserve Base, IBM, Lockheed Martin, Georgia-Pacific, GE and Coca-Cola corporations. Enjoy a spacious guest room or hotel suite featuring signature bedding, wireless high-speed internet access, and a 27-inch TV with premium cable. Indulge in a suite that offers a separate parlor area with a sofa bed, private bedroom and refrigerator.Maintain your exercise regimen in our on-site hotel fitness center or go swimming in the unique indoor/outdoor pool. Our 24-hour business center overlooks a water garden, and provides complimentary WiFi, two Uniguest computers, and other services.
